intro: Cephalaria squamiflora subsp. mediterranea, commonly known as the Mediterranean squamifloracephalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a perennial herb with upright, branching stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or calcareous habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
